qas.question: How often does Namibia conduct a census?
When was the first Population and Housing Census in Namibia?
What is it called when the census counts every person wherever they are the night of the census?
How many enumeration areas are there in Namibia?
The enumeration areas in Namibia do not overlap with what in order to get reliable data?
How were people counted in Namibia prior to 1991?
How many enumeration areas are there in a typical nation using the de facto method?
How many census workers were there in the 1991 Population and Housing Census?

context: Namibia conducts a census <a0_0>every ten years<a0_0/>. After independence the first <b5_0>Population and Housing Census<b5_0/> was carried out in <a1_0>1991<a1_0/>, further rounds followed in 2001 and 2011. The data collection method is to count every person resident in Namibia on the census reference night, wherever they happen to be. This is called the <a2_0>de facto method<a2_0/>. For enumeration purposes the country is demarcated into <a3_0><b6_0><b7_0>4,042<b7_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/> enumeration areas. These areas do not overlap with <a4_0>constituency boundaries<a4_0/> to get reliable data for election purposes as well.
